title: Sources: Vols moving on from QB Iamaleava
content: Tennessee is moving on from starting quarterback Nico Iamaleava, sources told ESPN, in the wake of his decision to not attend practice Friday amid NIL contract discussions with the school.

title: Jokic third ever to average triple-double in season
content: Nikola Jokic will average a triple-double for the season, joining Russell Westbrook and Oscar Robertson as the only players in NBA history to achieve that feat.

title: Reports: Carr's '25 status at risk due to shoulder
content: Saints quarterback Derek Carr has a shoulder injury that could put his status for the 2025 season in jeopardy, according to multiple reports.

title: Luka likes title chances as Lakers lock up 3-seed
content: Luka Doncic and Austin Reaves expressed confidence in the Lakers' title hopes after Los Angeles clinched the No. 3 seed in the West with a 140-109 win over Houston.

title: Sources: C's Brown got painkilling shot in knee
content: Celtics star Jaylen Brown received pain management injections in right knee this week, sources told ESPN's Ramona Shelburne, but he is expected to be ready for the playoffs.

title: Rose remains atop bunched Masters leaderboard
content: Justin Rose is still in the lead at the Masters. He suddenly has a lot of all-star company around him.

title: Langer signs off as run at weekend falls 1 short
content: In his final Masters, Bernhard Langer missed playing the weekend by one shot, with his par putt on the 18th hole Friday narrowly off the mark.

title: Curry awaits 'Game 7 vibe' in crucial Clippers tilt
content: With a top-six playoff seeding on the line, Stephen Curry said he will be ready to go for a critical regular-season finale Sunday against the Clippers.

title: Rising up the board: WNBA draft tix prices soar
content: The price of tickets to attend Monday night's WNBA draft has nearly doubled from last year. The Dallas Wings hold the No. 1 pick with UConn's Paige Bueckers expected to be the first selection.

title: What will a stacked leaderboard bring? Looking ahead to Saturday at the Masters
content: With names like Rose, McIlroy and DeChambeau in contention, it is shaping up to be an exciting weekend.

title: Experts' picks, best bets: What Volkanovski must do to regain UFC championship
content: Who has the edge in the UFC 314 featherweight title fight? A fighter and betting insider make their picks.

title: Everything at stake on the final day of the NBA regular season
content: The East bracket is set. The West's ... is not. Meanwhile, lottery races across the league will be decided Sunday.

title: NBA postseason tracker: Eastern Conference playoffs set
content: Tracking which teams have clinched for the playoffs with the 2024-25 NBA regular season nearing its conclusion.

title: 'Everybody in the organization was miserable': Inside the Nuggets' shocking dual firings
content: With less than a week left in the regular season, Denver fired its head coach and GM, ending a yearslong cold war, and risking the NBA's most precious commodity: the prime of three-time NBA MVP Nikola Jokic.

title: Bayern, Dortmund cannot afford to lose
content: Saturday's Klassiker isn't first vs. second, but Bayern and Dortmund's seasons hinge on their rivalry match.

title: Power Rankings: Predictions for 2025-26 contention status
content: From top Cup contenders to teams on the bubble to those still building, here's the "next year now" for all 32.

title: WNBA mock draft: Who comes after No. 1 Paige Bueckers?
content: The No. 2 pick sees an international entry, while Hailey Van Lith, Sedona Prince drop out of the first round.

title: With Flacco signing, Browns in position to forgo drafting QB at No. 2
content: With Flacco back in the fold, the Browns have a veteran quarterback on the roster whom they can trust to run the offense in 2025.

title: Arteta hails Rice ignoring set-piece coach vs. Real
content: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta has praised Declan Rice after the midfielder revealed that he ignored the advice of the club's set-piece coach before scoring the first of two sensational free kicks against Real Madrid on Tuesday.

title: Salah signs two-year Liverpool contract extension
content: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has signed a contract extension, ending monthslong uncertainty over his future at Anfield, the club announced.

title: Pulisic assist helps Milan to emphatic Serie A win
content: AC Milan secured a convincing 4-0 victory at Udinese in Serie A on Friday, with Sérgio Conceição's side earning its first win in nearly a month.

title: USMNT to open Gold Cup vs. T&T in San Jose
content: The United States will open the CONCACAF Gold Cup against Trinidad and Tobago on June 15 at San Jose, California, play Saudi Arabia four days later at Austin, Texas, and close first-round play in Group D against Haiti on June 22 at Arlington, Texas.

title: Miedema likely out for season with injury - Cushing
content: Manchester City boss Nick Cushing expects Vivianne Miedema to miss the rest of the season through injury.

title: Milan boss praises Udinese fans' Maignan gesture
content: AC Milan coach Sérgio Conceição praised the way Udinese fans applauded Mike Maignan when he had to be carried off on a stretcher following a collision with AC Milan teammate Álex Jiménez.

title: USWNT's Midge Purce fit to return after year out
content: Gotham FC and USWNT winger Midge Purce is in line to return from a year-long injury absence in Sunday's NWSL clash with the North Carolina Courage.

title: Amorim hesitant to rotate in EPL: 'You can't at Utd'
content: Ruben Amorim has said he won't throw away games in the Premier League to aid Manchester United's bid to win the Europa League ahead of their tough trip to Newcastle United on Sunday.

title: Bernhard Langer's last supper
content: The 67-year-old finished one stroke outside the cut line at his 41st and final Masters, capping off a career that spanned eras.

title: The Kid behind the camera: Best of Ken Griffey Jr.'s 2025 Masters photography
content: Baseball Hall of Famer Ken Griffey Jr. is roaming the greens of Augusta as a credentialed photographer.

title: 'An ordinary guy': What's John Daly doing at the Hooters in Augusta?
content: Daly hasn't played the Masters since 2006, but every year he shows up in town to hang and sell merch.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United want €60m for Højlund deal
content: Man United are reportedly ready to cut their losses on striker Rasmus Højlund. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Govt. nod for ‘child-secure State action plan’
content: Its main objective is to reduce and, eventually, eliminate violence, particularly sexual violence, against children

title: Nainar Nagenthran elected as Tamil Nadu BJP chief
content: BJP leader and Union Minister G Kishan Reddy, and party national general secretary Tarun Chugh, at a party meeting, declared Nagenthran duly elected as Tamil Nadu unit president

title: India votes in favour of first global carbon tax on shipping
content: The decision, taken at the International Maritime Organisation headquarters in London, aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from ships and promote cleaner technologies

title: PMO favouring Goa, says Raita Sena; seeks resignation of Minister Pralhad Joshi
content: Sri Viresh Sobaradmath Swami questions the reported letter from the PMO directing the State govt. to give environmental clearance for Goa’s power project

title: CMFRI to be nodal agency for 5th national marine fisheries census planned for November-December
content: Census will cover 1.20 million households across coastal States and Union Territories and will document their socio-economic conditions, apart from mapping fisheries infra that spans India’s entire coastline

title: Kerala CM sore over poor turnout at hospital event in Vadakara
content: Kerala Chief Minister expresses displeasure over absence of public and local leaders at foundation stone-laying ceremony for new district hospital building

title: Beyond the ladder: Telangana to focus on internal fire safety measures in high-rise structures
content: The Fire Services Department, in coordination with the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation and other stakeholders, is also considering bringing non-high-rise commercial buildings under the ambit of fire regulations

title: 3 Killed In Bengal Waqf Protests, Court Orders Deployment Of Central Forces
content: Three people were killed in West Bengal's Murshidabad district following violent clashes linked to ongoing protests against the Waqf (Amendment) Act, the police said on Saturday.

title: Tamil Nadu Gets New BJP Chief, Day After Alliance Announced With AIADMK
content: The BJP on Saturday elected Nainar Nagenthiran as the President of its Tamil Nadu unit. Mr Nagendran, a three-time MLA from Tirunelveli, replaces K Annamalai in the top job.

title: BJP Slaps Down Mamata Banerjee's Appeal As 3 Die In Waqf Law Protests
content: A teen boy was shot amid police firing in Bengal's Murshidabad Saturday as protests over changes to the Waqf laws - which govern how Muslim charitable properties are administered - enter a second consecutive day.

title: Probe Agency Takes Action On Key Properties In Congress-Linked Herald Case
content: Probe agency begins process of taking possession of Herald House, other properties in National Herald case linked to Congress

title: Georgia Becomes First US State To Introduce Bill Against Hinduphobia
content: The state of Georgia has introduced a bill to propose the formal recognition of Hinduphobia and anti-Hindu bigotry.

title: On Thermal Camera, Terrorists' Infiltration Attempt Near LoC In J&K
content: On late Friday night, terrorists attempted to infiltrate into India from Pakistan near the Line of Control (LoC) in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Tahawwur Rana Probe Reveals Elusive "Dubai Man" Who Knew Of 26/11 Attacks
content: More than 15 years after the 26/11 Mumbai terror attack, anti-terror agency NIA is now zeroing in on an elusive figure who allegedly met Tahawwur Rana, one of the key accused, in Dubai before the carnage.

title: IPL LIVE: Nicholas Pooran Hits 50 As 2-Down LSG Dominate GT In Chase
content: Lucknow Super Giants vs Gujarat Titans LIVE Score, IPL 2025: Prasidh Krishna has provided Gujarat Titans with the precious wicket of Aiden Markram for 58.

title: Video: Haryana Student Caught Smuggling Girlfriend Into Hostel In Suitcase
content: A student of a private university in Haryana has become the centre of an unusual controversy after being caught attempting to smuggle a girl, believed to be his girlfriend, into the university's boys' hostel.

title: Delhi Chief Minister Sees Man Feeding Roti To Cow On Busy Road. Does This
content: Ms Gupta posted the video of her interaction with the man on X and requested Delhiites not to throw 'roti' or any food on the road.

title: Ukraine Could Resemble Postwar Berlin, With Allied Zones Of Control: US Envoy
content: He suggested that British and French troops could serve as a "reassurance force" in western Ukraine, while Russian forces maintain control over the eastern regions they've occupied. A demilitarised zone, Ukrainian troops would separate the two forces

title: On Camera, Noida Woman Grabs Another's Hair, Pins Her Down, Calls For Cops
content: A residential complex in Uttar Pradesh's Noida erupted into chaos when a personal dispute between two women residents spiralled into a physical altercation at the society's main gate.

title: "Brain Stopped Working?" Dhoni Faces Savage Question After CSK's Loss
content: MS Dhoni-led Chennai Super Kings slumped to their biggest defeat in the IPL (in terms of balls remaining) on Friday against Kolkata Knight Riders

title: "Let's Rush To Hospital": More Details Emerge In Saif Attack Chargesheet
content: Saif Ali Khan, 54, was repeatedly stabbed with a knife by an intruder inside his 12th floor apartment in Mumbai's Bandra on January 16.

title: Andhra Pradesh Results LIVE: 70% Clear Class 11 Exam, 83% Pass Class 12
content: Andhra Pradesh 1st 2nd Year Result 2025 LIVE Updates: To access their BIEAP Manabadi Results 2025, students must enter their hall ticket number and date of birth on the result portal.

title: Jalandhar blast case: Key accused held for targetting BJP leader's home
content: Punjab Police arrested Saidul Ameen, the main suspect in the Jalandhar grenade attack on BJP leader Manoranjan Kalia's residence. The arrest occurred in Delhi with support from central agencies and Delhi Police. Two local associates were previously arrested for providing logistical support. Investigations are ongoing to find handlers, financial supporters, and any foreign links to the attack.

title: New Malinga alert! SRH bring in Malinga 2.0 to silence Punjab Kings
content: Punjab Kings, led by Shreyas Iyer, chose to bat first after winning the toss against Sunrisers Hyderabad at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium. Sunrisers Hyderabad made one change, bringing in Eshan Malinga for Kamindu Mendis. Malinga, a Sri Lankan pacer known for his death-overs expertise, was acquired for Rs 1.2 crore in the IPL 2025 auction.

title: Zerodha CEO Kamath to investors: Over the next 10 days, there are only …
content: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath advises investors to pause trading during the upcoming truncated weeks due to heightened market volatility. He emphasizes the importance of mental preparedness and suggests using the break to recharge. Kamath warns against trading in unfavorable conditions, highlighting that staying out allows for future trading opportunities when both mental state and market conditions are optimal.

title: 'I keep things simple': Ashutosh Sharma opens up on Impact Player role
content: Ahead of Delhi Capitals' clash with Mumbai Indians, Ashutosh Sharma discussed his match-winning innings against Lucknow, emphasising process and adaptability. He praised Axar Patel's leadership and the team's open environment. Sharma highlighted his improved understanding of match situations and his determination to perform, setting the stage for a potentially explosive home game.

title: Why Trump's tariffs are good news for India: UN trade expert explains
content: A UN trade official warns that escalating US tariffs and China's retaliation could shrink global trade by 3%, prompting shifts in export flows towards emerging economies like India and Brazil. The tariff war is causing supply chain reorientation, impacting developing nations reliant on sectors like textiles. Experts suggest China is strategically positioning itself for long-term advantage amidst the trade tensions.

title: Bombay Shaving Company CEO on why people in their 40s losing jobs
content: Bombay Shaving Company's CEO, Shantanu Deshpande, has drawn attention to the increasing vulnerability of professionals in their 40s amidst corporate layoffs in India. He highlights their financial burdens and susceptibility to cost-cutting measures due to higher salaries. Deshpande advises upskilling in AI, saving more, and developing an entrepreneurial mindset to stay relevant in the evolving job market.

title: Nainar Nagenthiran succeeds Annamalai as Tamil Nadu BJP president
content: The BJP has appointed Nainar Nagenthiran as the new Tamil Nadu unit president, succeeding K Annamalai. This decision follows the announcement of the BJP's alliance with AIADMK for the 2026 elections. Nagenthiran, a former AIADMK minister and current BJP MLA, is viewed as a crucial link between the parties.

title: Watch: Virat Kohli shares a heartfelt hug with Rahul Dravid in Jaipur
content: Before the IPL clash, Virat Kohli and Rahul Dravid shared a warm moment. Kohli embraced Dravid, who is recovering from a leg injury. The meeting highlighted the camaraderie in Indian cricket. Rajasthan Royals shared the moment on social media. Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Rajasthan Royals aim to recover from recent losses. The teams will battle on Sunday.

title: First time in 1108 days! Rishabh Pant walks out to open in T20s
content: Rishabh Pant's unexpected return to opening the innings for Lucknow Super Giants against Gujarat Titans in IPL 2025 sparked excitement. This strategic move aims to leverage his explosive batting during the Powerplay, marking a significant shift after primarily playing in the middle order. Pant's previous T20 opening record boasts a strong strike rate and average, including a century.

title: Walmart boycott: World's largest retailer tells protesters, 'we are America's ...'
content: Walmart is facing a week-long boycott, "Walmart Blackout," organized by People’s Union USA over DEI rollbacks and tax policies. Walmart defends its community contributions and economic impact, citing significant tax payments and charitable donations. Data suggests Walmart is more resilient to boycotts compared to Target, which experienced a larger impact from similar protests.

title: National Herald case: ED begins process to seize assets worth Rs 700cr tied to Cong
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has initiated proceedings to seize assets worth over Rs 700 crore belonging to Associated Journals Limited (AJL), a company linked to Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, in connection with the National Herald case. The properties include prime locations in Delhi, Mumbai, and Lucknow, notably the Herald House in Delhi.

title: US, Iran begin 'indirect' talks over Tehran's nuclear programme
content: Indirect talks between Iran and the United States have commenced in Oman, mediated by Omani officials, focusing on nuclear issues and sanctions relief. Iran's foreign ministry confirmed the discussions between Seyed Abbas Araghchi and Steve Witkoff, while emphasizing the need for an agreement that secures Iran's national interests.

title: Happy Baisakhi: Top 50 wishes, messages & quotes to share with loved ones
content: Baisakhi, a significant festival in North India, especially Punjab, marks the Sikh New Year and the harvest season. It commemorates the formation of the Khalsa Panth by Guru Gobind Singh Ji in 1699, a pivotal moment in Sikh history. Celebrations include vibrant cultural performances, fairs, and prayers for a prosperous harvest, bringing communities together in joy and gratitude.

title: Watch: Delhi CM spots man throwing food. Here's what happened next
content: Delhi's chief minister, Rekha Gupta, has appealed to citizens to refrain from discarding food, particularly chapati, on roads. She emphasized that this practice endangers animals and compromises road safety. Gupta urged residents to feed stray animals at designated sites like 'gaushalas,' promoting responsible and respectful animal care.

title: Three children drown in pond in Annamayya district
content: The trio, all aged seven, drowned after venturing into a pond at M. Rachapalli village in Chitvel mandal, when the residents were busy with a temple procession in connection with the Sri Rama Navami festivities

title: Land acquisition for Erumely airport receives administrative sanction
content: The order empowers the government to proceed with the acquisition of land in accordance with LARR Act, 2013

title: I know what you are going to do next summer
content: The UK is developing a “murder prediction” programme to identify the people most likely to become killers

title: Several injured in protest against Waqf law in Tripura town; Central forces deployed
content: Thousands take out march at Kailashahar and Sonamura in Sepahijala district seeking repeal of the contentious law

title: Justice Palli appointed new J&K High Court Chief Justice
content: A judge of the Punjab and Haryana High Court, Justice Palli succeeds Justice Tashi Rabstan, who demitted office on April 9 on attaining 62 years of age.

title: Waqf Board Amendment Bill unconstitutional, says CPI leader
content: Party cadres seek immediate withdrawal of police notices to the protestors of the minority community in Uttar Pradesh and caution that Left parties will undertake a nationwide agitation if the Bill is not withdrawn

title: 69 % of domestic tourists visiting State are Keralites
content: Among domestic tourists visiting the State, around 20% were from south Indian States with Tamil Nadu leading with 10.5%

title: YouTuber Jaspreet Singh appears before Assam Police over case for 'promoting obscenity'
content: YouTuber and stand-up comedian Jaspreet Singh appeared before the investigating officer (IO) of the Guwahati Police's Crime Branch in the afternoon for questioning in connection with the case registered on February 10.

title: Taylor Swift sent gift to Travis' family days before Kanye controversy
content: Amidst recent controversies, including Kanye West's explicit posts, Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce offered a heartwarming gesture to Jason and Kylie Kelce, who welcomed their fourth daughter. They sent flowers and gifts, a sweet gesture appreciated by the new parents. While dealing with other issues, Swift has remained silent on West's actions, though legal action is reportedly underway.

title: US state of Georgia takes major step to combat Hinduphobia
content: Georgia is set to become the first US state to address Hinduphobia. Senate Bill 375 aims to include Hinduphobia in anti-discrimination laws. State agencies will consider Hinduphobia when enforcing these laws. Prosecutors may use the definition in hate crime cases. The bill protects free speech rights. A clause ensures the law is enacted as a whole.

title: No more notebooks! Digvesh Rathi signs the turf after Buttler wicket
content: Lucknow Super Giants' Digvesh Rathi is grabbing attention in IPL 2025 with his unique 'notebook celebration' after taking wickets. However, his theatrics have landed him in trouble. Rathi was fined for unsportsmanlike conduct after repeating the gesture, accumulating demerit points. Despite facing financial penalties, Rathi remains undeterred, showcasing his bowling skills and spirited celebrations.

title: Katy Perry & Blue Origin’s crew to launch to space on April 14: Details
content: Pop icon Katy Perry will fly into space on Blue Origin's NS-31 mission. This marks the first all-female crew since 1963. The mission aims to promote gender diversity in spaceflight. Perry will be joined by Lauren Sanchez, Gayle King, Aisha Bowe, Amanda Nguyen, and Kerianne Flynn. The flight is scheduled for April 14, 2025, and will be live-streamed.

title: In a first, SC sets 3-month deadline for President to decide on Bills
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that neither the President nor the governor has absolute veto power over state bills. They must provide reasons for withholding assent. The court set timelines for decisions on bills. Governors have one month for assent or three months to refer the bill. The President also has three months to decide.

title: Watch: 14-year-old Suryavanshi impresses against Archer in RR nets
content: Young Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old batting sensation, showcased his talent against England's Jofra Archer in the Rajasthan Royals' practice session. Despite Archer's pace and experience, Vaibhav demonstrated composure, confidently handling bouncers and playing impressive shots. The youngest player in IPL history, Vaibhav's net session highlights his rapid rise in cricket.

title: Woman reduces 56kg; shares diet, workout plan: Here's her little secret
content: Rutvi Shah, a Bengaluru professional, has inspired many by shedding 56 kilos since October 2021. She emphasizes consistency in exercise, combining strength training with cardio, and maintaining a balanced diet. Rutvi also highlights the importance of cheat days and making healthy eating enjoyable, while cautioning against overemphasizing protein at the expense of other essential nutrients like fiber and micronutrients.

title: Waqf protests: Fresh violence breaks out in Murshidabad; 1 injured
content: Murshidabad district in West Bengal sees renewed violence. One person is shot in Dhulian. This follows unrest over the Waqf Amendment Act. Authorities suspect BSF involvement in the shooting. Police have arrested 118 people. Senior officers are managing the situation. A teenager was injured during clashes. The Director General of Police urges people to avoid rumours.

title: ICC mulls scrapping two-ball rule in ODIs to restore balance
content: The ICC is contemplating significant alterations to ODI cricket, potentially eliminating the two new-ball rule to restore equilibrium between batting and bowling. This proposal, spearheaded by Sourav Ganguly, suggests reverting to a single ball, addressing concerns about the decline of reverse swing and challenges faced by spinners.

title: Over 350 flights delayed at Delhi airport due to congestion
content: Delhi's IGIA faced significant disruptions as over 350 flights were delayed due to ongoing air traffic congestion, impacting operations for a second consecutive day. Passengers experienced long queues and crowded terminals. While flight operations are improving, residual effects from adverse weather conditions persist. IndiGo confirmed that flights are being held due to congestion, affecting its network.

title: Rana extradition: Cong says UPA deserves credit, Shiv Sena hits back
content: A political dispute has erupted over Tahawwur Rana's extradition to India, with Congress claiming credit for initiating the process during the UPA government. Shiv Sena countered, accusing Congress of appeasement politics and crediting Prime Minister Modi's diplomatic efforts for the extradition. The debate highlights differing views on the handling of the 26/11 Mumbai attacks case.

title: 'Of the fans, by the fans, for the fans!' - CSK share emotional message
content: Chennai Super Kings faced another setback in IPL 2025, suffering their fifth consecutive defeat and recording their lowest-ever total at Chepauk against Kolkata Knight Riders. Despite the return of MS Dhoni as captain, CSK's batting faltered against KKR's spin attack.

title: 'I'll quit cricket and become professor': Rizwan on poor English
content: Pakistan's white-ball captain, Mohammad Rizwan, has responded to criticism regarding his English-speaking skills, asserting that his priority is cricket, not language proficiency. He expressed pride in his heartfelt communication and acknowledged his educational shortcomings. Rizwan also addressed the team's recent struggles and welcomed constructive criticism, highlighting the importance of enjoying the Pakistan Super League.

title: Sukhbir Singh Badal re-elected as Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) president
content: Sukhbir Singh Badal has been re-elected as the president of the Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD). The party announced this on social media, expressing hopes that he will protect the rights of the Panth and Punjab. Badal, son of the late Parkash Singh Badal, previously served as Deputy Chief Minister and is seen as a key strategist within the party.

title: 'Will not implement Waqf Act': Bengal CM Mamata amid violent protests
content: West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee declared that her state would not implement the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025, following violent protests in areas like Jangipur and Murshidabad. She appealed for peace and harmony, emphasizing that the law was enacted by the central government. Banerjee cautioned against political misuse of religion and warned of legal action against those inciting riots.

title: Alex Ovechkin sets tone and Washington Capitals boys follow it
content: Alex Ovechkin led the Washington Capitals to a thrilling 5-4 victory against the Carolina Hurricanes, bringing their record to an impressive 50-19-9. Ovechkin emphasized his role in setting the tone for the team as they prepare to face the Columbus Blue Jackets tonight. Before joining the Capitals, Ovechkin played for FC Dynamo Moscow, expressing his love for both teams.

title: Cabinet acceptance of caste census report: Chunk of credit goes to Congress high command
content: At the Congress session, Rahul Gandhi reiterated the party’s demand for a nationwide caste census and said the party would replicate across the country what Telangana had recently implemented

title: Watch: Devotees flock to temples across India on the occasion of Hanuman Jayanti
content: Here’s a look at how devotees observed the occasion in Ayodhya, Prayagraj, Ahmedabad, Shimla, Delhi and Hyderabad

title: Muslims unhappy with Waqf Act, AIUDF reminds Assam CM
content: The minority-based party said Himanta Biswa Sarma should not be under the illusion that the Muslims in the State would not fight against the BJP’s bid to snatch Waqf property

title: Prime accused in Jalandhar grenade blast case held from Delhi: Punjab Police
content: Further investigations are vigorously progressing to uncover handlers, financial backers and potential foreign connections linked to the attack, says Director General of Police Gaurav Yadav

title: Autorickshaws allowed inside Tiruchi Airport, courier service to begin soon, says Durai Vaiko
content: The Tiruchi MP says it was a result of his recent meeting with  airport director; says it improves passenger access besides supporting the livelihood of autorickshaw drivers

title: It’s golden jubilee for India’s first satellite Aryabhata
content: The name was chosen by the then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi from a list of three options: Aryabhata, Mitra, Jawahar. Indian Space Research Organisation has conceived and built 131 satellites since then. India now has  55 satellites in orbit.

title: Why Rishabh Pant excluded Mitchell Marsh?
content: Rishabh Pant, the captain of Lucknow Super Giants, won the toss and chose to field first against Gujarat Titans at the Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium in their IPL 2025 match. Himmat Singh replaced Mitchell Marsh in the Lucknow Super Giants lineup, while Washington Sundar was included in Gujarat Titans team instead of Kulwant Khejroliya.

title: Michael Strahan’s daughter shares how she struggled with isolation and fitting in after USC return
content: Michael Strahan's daughter, Isabella Strahan, battled brain cancer. She spoke about her struggles during college. Isabella felt left behind as friends formed groups. She saw her twin sister Sophia vacationing. This happened while she underwent treatment. Isabella overcame negative thoughts after beating cancer. She reunited with Sophia. They now enjoy vacations together. Michael Strahan now prioritizes family time.

title: UPI down: GPay, PhonePe, Paytm and other apps hit by outage
content: UPI faced another widespread outage, disrupting payment and fund transfer services for thousands. Downdetector reported over 2,200 complaints, highlighting transaction failures across major platforms like Google Pay, PhonePe, Paytm, and banking apps including SBI, ICICI and HDFC. This marks the third UPI disruption in approximately three weeks, raising concerns about the reliability of the digital payment system.

title: Watch: Rahul meets textile designers, shares story behind first Nehru jacket
content: Rahul Gandhi met with textile design workers, highlighting the lack of OBC representation at the top of the industry. He shared the story of Vicky, a talented entrepreneur, and his hardworking factory workers, emphasizing the undervaluation of skill and the systemic barriers faced by marginalized communities in accessing education and networks.

title: 'Irresponsible!': Netanyahu to Canada's Carney over Gaza 'genocide' remarks
content: Israeli PM Netanyahu criticized Canadian PM Mark Carney for seemingly acknowledging "genocide in Gaza," calling out to him to retract the statement. Carney later clarified he misheard the protestor and was referencing Gaza broadly. Israeli officials denied a full arms embargo, stating only limited export permit suspensions exist, not a declaration of genocide.

title: Waqf protest: Internet suspended, over 110 held after violence in Murshidabad
content: Over 110 individuals were apprehended following unrest in West Bengal's Murshidabad district during a demonstration against the Waqf (Amendment) Act. The violence, which spread to other districts, involved torched vehicles and clashes with police. Authorities have imposed restrictions and suspended internet services in affected areas.

title: IPL 2025: Is it all over for Chennai Super Kings this season? Not quite
content: Chennai Super Kings, reeling from five consecutive losses after an initial win, face mounting pressure in IPL 2025. Their recent defeat against Kolkata Knight Riders on Friday saw a record low score at their home ground. Sitting in ninth place with just two points from six matches, is it all over for CSK and their playoff chances?

title: 5.8 magnitude earthquake strikes Pakistan, tremors felt in J&K
content: A moderate 5.8 magnitude earthquake struck Pakistan, with tremors felt in Jammu and Kashmir. The earthquake, occurring at a shallow depth of 10 kilometers, raised concerns about potential aftershocks. Pakistan's location on the boundary of the Eurasian and Indian tectonic plates makes it highly susceptible to earthquakes. Earlier, Tajikistan, Pakistan’s neighbor, was also jolted by a 4.2 magnitude earthquake.

title: 'We are a family': Shaheen Afridi comes to Babar Azam's rescue - Watch
content: During a pre-season press conference for the Pakistan Super League, Shaheen Afridi defended teammates Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan when questioned about Pakistan's struggles chasing high scores in T20 cricket. Afridi emphasised that responsibility for winning games falls on both the batting and bowling units. He stressed team unity and the collective goal of restoring Pakistan's cricket success.

title: New US immigration rules mean even H-1B holders could be asked for papers
content: New rule in the US requires immigrants to register with the government and carry documentation. The regulation impacts foreign nationals, including those on work or study visas. Children must re-register at 14. Change of address must be reported within ten days. Failure to comply can result in fines, imprisonment, and jeopardize US stay.

title: 'No condemnation of bloodshed': BJP targets Bengal CM Mamata over Murshidabad violence
content: Following violent unrest in Jalangi, Murshidabad, BJP leaders have launched sharp attacks on West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, accusing her of inaction after a BDO office was vandalized during protests against the Waqf Amendment Act. Suvendu Adhikari condemned the violence, blaming "radical elements" for undermining the Constitution. BJP leaders are alleging appeasement politics and failure to protect Hindus.

title: Sukhbir Badal re-elected as SAD president in Punjab; Akali rebels call it a jolt to unity efforts
content: Mr. Badal’s name was proposed by party’s working president Balwinder Singh Bhundar while party leader Paramjit Singh Sarna seconded it

title: Governor cannot refer State Bills to President because of ‘personal dissatisfaction’: Supreme Court
content: The top court said that the reservation of a Bill for consideration of the President would be solely on the grounds of great peril to democratic principles with clearly assigned reasons

title: Electronic Voting Machines safe, tamper-proof: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar said EVMs used in India cannot be connected to internet, bluetooth or infrared and it is not possible anyway to tamper with it

title: Three docs booked as pregnant woman dies at UP hospital; CMO recommends sealing facility
content: Chief Medical Officer (CMO) Dr Sanjay Sharma said that the unregistered medical facility named Nandini Hospital was being operated at Shahpur Jot under the Kotwali Dehat police station area.

title: Hanuman Jayanti procession begins amid tight security and devotion in Hyderabad
content: Amid heavy police deployment, the ceremonial chariot carrying a statue of Lord Hanuman rolled out of Gowliguda at around 11.30 a.m., following a special pooja at the temple

title: Kurnool Municipal Corporation nets property tax of ₹5.5 crore in just 12 days
content: Officials expect a good collection following the government’s offer of 5% discount on property tax paid for  the year

title: Four dead, five injured as MUV overturns in Madhya Pradesh's Jhabua
content: “The incident took place at 10 p.m. on April 11, near Bolasa village, some 48 km from the district headquarters,” Raipuriya police State SHO J. R. Barde said

title: Rahul Gandhi claims OBC artisans, trapped in vicious circle of neglect
content: The artisans in his factory work hard for 12 hours a day, weaving magic with needle and thread. But the situation is the same, there is no appreciation for the skill, says Rahul Gandhi

title: National Herald case: ED issues notice to take possession of assets in Congress-linked AJL case
content: ‘These properties were attached after extensive investigation by the ED which revealed significant generation, possession, and use of proceeds of crime to the tune of ₹988 crore,’ the agency said

title: Amid protests, Mamata Banerjee says Waqf Amendment Act will not be implemented in West Bengal
content: "We do not condone any violent activity. Some political parties are trying to misuse religion for political gain. Do not give in to their persuasion," the West Bengal CM said.

title: Waqf protests: 3 killed in fresh violence reported from West Bengal's Murshidabad
content: “Two death in communal clashes. One person who was injured in the firing yesterday in Suti has died a short while ago,” a senior police official told The Hindu.

title: Caste census is scientific; such surveys necessary to assess health of society: Former head of BC Commission Kantharaj
content: “The caste is a reality in India. Caste-based discrimination should be eradicated to achieve equality. The survey and census are essential to understand how caste has been strong in the society,” Kantharaj said

title: Tamil Nadu Governor case: Supreme Court recalls first President’s power struggle over Hindu Code Bill
content: The top court recalled that Dr. Rajendra Prasad had sought to assert his independent authority to withhold assent to the legislation, highlighting constitutional role of Indian President

title: Pastor Praveen Pagadala was under influence of alcohol, succumbed to head injury in an accident, says IG G.V.G. Ashok Kumar
content: On March 23, Mr. Praveen Kumar was sighted purchasing liquor in three locations and escaped three accidents. He was sighted for the last time at 11.42 p.m. a few minutes before his two-wheeler skidded into a field on the outskirts of Rajamahendravaram city as shown in the CCTV footage

title: Congress betrayed Ambedkar’s ideals: MP D.K. Aruna
content: The Congress had tried to mislead the people by saying that if voted to power, the BJP would take the drastic step of altering the basic structure of the Constitution, says party national vice-president

title: Intermediate Public Examinations: Happy to see improved results, says Andhra Minister Nara Lokesh
content: State HRD Minister Nara Lokesh said students who could not succeed this time should not lose heart. “They should use this as a stepping stone, keep working hard, and come back stronger,” he advised

title: 5.8-magnitude earthquake hits J&K; no damage to life or property
content: The earthquake occurred in Pakistan at a depth of 10 kilometres and struck Jammu and Kashmir at around 1 p.m.

title: ATREE researchers rediscover long-lost species after 111 years
content: Ashoka Trust for Research in Ecology and The Environment researchers rediscovers ancient velvet worm species in Arunachal Pradesh, shedding light on evolutionary history and “biogeographic mysteries”

title: Supreme Court puts President on a deadline, says prudent to consult apex court before taking a call on State Bills
content: A Bench of Justices J.B. Pardiwala and R. Mahadevan declared that the President ought to, as a measure of prudence, seek the Supreme Court’s advice on Bills reserved by a Governor for her consideration on grounds of perceived unconstitutionality

title: Congress must talk about status of INDIA bloc: Shiv Sena (UBT)
content: The Sena (UBT) pointed out that the Congress only spoke about itself in the Ahmedabad meet, and INDIA or Bharat was nowhere in the discussion

title: UPI outage: Several users say transactions failing; NPCI says working to resolve ‘intermittent technical issues’
content: This is the second UPI outage in April excluding the routine issues faced by certain banks on their platform at the closing of the financial year

title: At least 69 killed in thunderstorms in India, Nepal
content: Deadly thunderstorms kill 69 in India and Nepal, highlighting the impact of climate change on extreme weather events

title: Nagaland Police set up SIT to probe allegations of sexual harassment against IAS officer
content: Several women working in IDAN have accused the IAS officer of asking for physical indulgence for a hike in salary and also employment

title: India will be number one in the world on 100th year of Independence: Amit Shah
content: The Home Minister was accompanied by Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, his deputies Eknath Shinde and Ajit Pawar

title: AIADMK’s women wing to protest against Minister Ponmudy’s derogatory remarks
content: “Many from the DMK are making derogatory remarks about women and religious beliefs. Ponmudy’s speech has angered people of the State especially women”, Mr. Palaniswami said, while strongly condemning the Minister’s speech.

title: Kuki groups warn Meiteis against climbing 'sacred' Thangjing Hill in Manipur
content: In a statement, six Kuki-Zo groups said any attempt to climb the hills would be viewed as a "direct challenge"

title: Government sites start trying Hindi web addresses
content: Many Union government sites have started experimenting with सरकार.भारत web addresses, as Universal Acceptance advocates push for greater regional language support for the web and email systems.

title: Gonda murder case: Five, including father-son, two brothers, handed life-term
content: The court of Additional Sessions Judge and Special Judge (POCSO Act) Rajesh Narayan Mani Tripathi also imposed a fine on the convicts on April 11, 2025

title: Tamil Nadu government notifies 10 Acts, following Supreme Court verdict
content: As per the notification, the Acts of the Tamil Nadu Legislative Assembly include The Tamil Nadu Fisheries University (Amendment) Act, 2020, which changes the name to the University to The Tamil Nadu Dr. J. Jayalalithaa Fisheries University.

title: Three Maoists killed in Chhattisgarh’s Bijapur
content: A senior police officer said that the forces had acted on a tip-off about the presence of Maoists in the forest under Indravati area of Bijapur district

title: Over 110 arrested in Murshidabad in violence over Waqf Act, raids on in other districts: WB Police
content: In the worst-hit Murshidabad district, prohibitory orders have been imposed and internet services suspended in places that saw violence

title: Twenty children rescued from illegal hostel in Maharashtra’s Thane district after complaint about abuse; five booked
content: The Child Helpline received a complaint on April 10, 2025 that children were being beaten up and sexually abused in the institution

title: Flight operations hit at Delhi Airport after dust storm; 50 flights delayed, several cancelled
content: Airport sources confirmed a heavy rush at boarding gates due to flight congestion, with passengers blaming the airline for poor management and crowd control

title: Two militants, one soldier killed in gunfights in J&K’s Kishtwar, Rajouri
content: According to sources, the militants shot dead in Kishtwar were affiliated with the Pakistan-based Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) outfit and included a top commander, Saifullah

title: Wetzel: House settlement officially ends college amateurism, and good riddance
content: amateurism, at least in college athletics, is a good settlement . it will soon open the door for college athletic departments to pay athletes directly with revenue gleaned from media rights, tickets, sponsorships and so on . many think it's what many think should have happened generations ago . this would be official death certificate, though .

title: Stanley Cup playoff watch: Your guide to NHL's 11-game Showdown Saturday
content: the NHL has reached Showdown Saturday, with less than a week to go in the season . there are 11 games on the schedule throughout the day . the Flyers begin the day in the no. 5 spot -- tied in points with the Boston Bruins .
